dataset¶

This module includes all functions and classes to take care of the data preprocessing. The main class to be used is XFoilDataset, which takes care of everything.

Classes

FourierEpicycles(n[, cat])

Compute the Fourier transform of the airfoil seen as a function of a complex variable.

GeometricData([x, edge_index, edge_attr, y, ...])

Class representing a 2D geometric graph.

TangentVec([norm, cat])

XFoilDataset([root, normalize, transform, ...])

This implementation of the class is made more complicated then necessary in order to be ready when I'll have to make a real dataset.
class dataset.FourierEpicycles(n: int, cat: bool | None = True)¶

Bases: BaseTransform

Compute the Fourier transform of the airfoil seen as a function of a complex variable. Save the first n modes as node features (only the real part is sufficient). If cat=False, overwrite the node features already present.

forward(data: Data) → Data¶
class dataset.GeometricData(x: None | Tensor = None, edge_index: None | Tensor = None, edge_attr: None | Tensor = None, y: Tensor | int | float | None = None, pos: None | Tensor = None, time: None | Tensor = None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: Data

Class representing a 2D geometric graph. Includes tangents and curvature methods, provided that the TangentVec transform has been previously called on an object of this class.

property curvature¶

Compute the curvature as the turning angle between two consecutive edges. Store it as a scalar vertex feature.

property tangents¶

The normalized tangent vectors to all edges of the graph.

class dataset.TangentVec(norm: bool = True, cat: bool = True)¶

Bases: BaseTransform

forward(data: Data) → Data¶
class dataset.XFoilDataset(root: str | None = None, normalize: bool | None = False, transform: Callable | None = None, pre_transform: Callable | None = None, pre_filter: Callable | None = None, log: bool | None = True, force_reload: bool | None = True)¶

Bases: Dataset

This implementation of the class is made more complicated then necessary in order to be ready when I’ll have to make a real dataset. Class for graphs representing 2D airfoils processed in XFloil. In particular the y attribute is the pressure distribution, and the y_glob one is the aerodynamic efficiency \((c_L/c_D)\). The nodes are supposed to be saved in order starting from the trailing edge, in counter-clockwise order. If normalize=True, standardize the global feature (default False).

Parameters:

  • root (str, optional) – root directoty (default None)

  • normalize (bool, optional) – if True, standardize global outputs (default False)

  • transform (Callable, optional) – function to call when retrieving a sample (default None)

  • pre_transform (Callable, optional) – function to call when initializing the class (default None)

  • pre_filter (Callable) – how to discard samples at initialization (default None)

  • log (bool, optional) – whether to print to console while performing actions (default True)

  • force_reload (bool, optional) – whether to re-process the dataset. (default False)

get(idx: int) → GeometricData¶

Gets the data object at index idx.

len()¶

Returns the number of data objects stored in the dataset.

process() → None¶

Read raw data, construct graphs, add tangents and edge lengths as edge features and curvature as vertex features. Save all processed data.

property processed_dir: str¶
property processed_file_names: str | List[str] | Tuple[str, ...]¶

The name of the files in the self.processed_dir folder that must be present in order to skip processing.

property raw_dir: str¶
property raw_file_names: str | List[str] | Tuple[str, ...]¶

The name of the files in the self.raw_dir folder that must be present in order to skip downloading.
